intro: Nitrophila mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed nitrophila, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to the eastern United States, this plant thrives in moist, acidic soils found in wetlands and along stream banks. The plant has a compact growth habit and often forms dense mats, which help stabilize soil and prevent erosion. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
